sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The historian's guide, or, Britain's remembrancer being a summary of all the actions, exploits, sieges, battels, designs, attempts, preferments, honours, changes &c. and whatever else is worthy notice that hath happen'd in His Majesty's kingdoms from Anno. Dom. 1600 to this time : shewing the year, month and day of the month in which each action was done : with an alphabeticall table for the more easie finding any thing out. Clarke, Samuel, 1599-1682.
[3], 213, [21] p. : port.
Printed for W. Crook, London : 1690.
Attributed to Samuel Clarke by NUC pre-1956 imprints. "To the reader" signed: W.C. [William Crooke]. Includes index. Portrait of James II on frontispiece. Reproduction of the original in the Harvard University Library.
=======

[3], 213, [21] p. : port.
Printed for W. Crook, London : 1690.
